AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: the country that enhanced Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero's base offense level, the sentencing and appealing party in the case of Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, destination country for undocumented aliens, entity hearing oral argument in the case, referenced in a court case involving reckless endangerment enhancement, agreed with the conduct being covered, correctly concluded that the United States guideline use of the phrase "creating a substantial risk" focuses on whether the chosen manner of traveling is "a very dangerous way to travel", referenced in relation to the meaning and context of the case, referenced in relation to increasing the base offense level
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexico: country of origin for undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo South Station: station where border patrol agents were from
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.La Moca Ranch: location where undocumented female alien was found
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: agency whose agents interacted with the aliens and were involved in the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals: a court of appeals that upheld the application of enhancement to a factual scenario similar to that before the United States, provided instructional case law
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Court of Appeals: a court that heard the case, addressed intent requirement for an enhancement
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Government: the government that pointed out dangers of journey for smuggled aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Congress: directed the Sentencing Commission to allow for sentencing enhancements in cases involving reckless endangerment during alien smuggling offenses
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Sentencing Commission: allowed for imposition of sentencing enhancement on defendants who engage in conduct placing others in serious danger of death or bodily injury during alien smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.House Conference Report No. 104-863: document comparing proposed and final versions of the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: the court that enhanced Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero's sentence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Herrera Court: a court of appeals that addressed intent requirement for an enhancement, found that no intent requirement is necessary for an enhancement under the subsection
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Guidelines Manual: source of commentary interpreting or explaining a guideline, provides authoritative commentary unless it violates the Constitution or a federal statute, or is inconsistent with, or a plainly erroneous reading of, a United States guideline
